citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The report of semi-annual evaluations submitted to the Institutional Official on December 8th, 2022 noted minor
deficiencies identified by the committee but did not contain a specific plan or schedule for correction. In order for the
Institutional Official to be able to discharge their responsibilities under the AWA, reports of semi-annual evaluations must
contain a reasonable and specific plan and schedule with dates for correcting each deficiency.
To be corrected by including the required information in all semi-annual reports submitted to the Institutional Official after
April 7th, 2023.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
On June 25, 2022, a facility staff member noted that pig #58014 had an abnormal gait when using its hind limbs. On June
27th, another employee noted that the animal continued to walk abnormally on the left hind limb. Information about this
problem of animal health identified by the facility was not conveyed to the attending veterinarian. The attending
veterinarian must be provided with timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well being
to ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care.
To be corrected by providing timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being to
the attending veterinarian from this date (April 6, 2023) forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(3) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The report of semi-annual evaluations submitted to the Institutional Official on December 8th, 2022 noted minor 
deficiencies identified by the committee but did not contain a specific plan or schedule for correction. In order for the 
Institutional Official to be able to discharge their responsibilities under the AWA, reports of semi-annual evaluations must 
contain a reasonable and specific plan and schedule with dates for correcting each deficiency. 
To be corrected by including the required information in all semi-annual reports submitted to the Institutional Official after 
April 7th, 2023. 
2.33(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
On June 25, 2022, a facility staff member noted that pig #58014 had an abnormal gait when using its hind limbs. On June 
27th, another employee noted that the animal continued to walk abnormally on the left hind limb. Information about this 
problem of animal health identified by the facility was not conveyed to the attending veterinarian. The attending 
veterinarian must be provided with timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well being 
to ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care.

To be corrected by providing timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being to 
the attending veterinarian from this date (April 6, 2023) forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
